articles.title: DPRK Delegation Leaves to Participate in NAM Ministerial Meeting
articles.content:
DPRK Delegation Leaves to Participate in NAM Ministerial Meeting
 Pyongyang, May 21 (KCNA) -- A DPRK delegation led by Pak Ui Chun, foreign minister of the DPRK, left here Saturday to participate in the meeting of ministers of foreign affairs of the non-aligned countries to be held in Indonesia.

articles.title: Congratulatory Message to Kuwaiti FM
articles.content:
Congratulatory Message to Kuwaiti FM
 Pyongyang, May 21 (KCNA) -- Foreign Minister of the DPRK Pak Ui Chun Friday sent a congratulatory message to Mohamed Sabah Al Salem Al Sabah upon his reappointment as deputy prime minister and foreign minister of Kuwait. 
					 The message wished him bigger success in his work for developing the country's foreign relations and expressed belief that the good relations of friendship and cooperation between the two countries would grow stronger in the future, too.

articles.title: Rice Transplantation Has Begun in DPRK
articles.content:
Rice Transplantation Has Begun in DPRK
 Pyongyang, May 21 (KCNA) -- Rice transplantation has begun in the DPRK.
					 The Wonhwa Co-op Farm, Phyongwon County, South Phyongan Province and the Chongsan Co-op Farm, Kangso District took the lead. Following them, all other farms across the country except those in the northern alpine areas started rice transplantation in time.
					
					 Those in South and North Phyongan provinces are giving definite precedence to leveling, watering and harrowing rice fields while operating rice transplanting machines in full capacity to attain actual results.
					
					 South Hwanghae Province has already transplanted rice seedlings in more than 10 000 hectares.
					
					 Rice transplantation is also going full swing ahead in Haeju City and Anak, Jaeryong and Sinchon counties.
					
					 The co-op farms in cities and counties in North Hwanghae Province including Sariwon City and Yonthan and Pongsan counties are also registering satisfactory results everyday.
					
					 Those in Pyongyang and Nampho cities made a good start taking into account the state of rice seedlings and weather conditions. 
					
					 Those along the east coast including Wonsan, Hamhung, Kimchaek, Chonnae, Hamju and Hwaedae are also working hard.

articles.title: Rodong Sinmun on Invincible Korean-style Socialism
articles.content:
Rodong Sinmun on Invincible Korean-style Socialism
 Pyongyang, May 21 (KCNA) -- Invincible is Korean-style socialism, the greatest legacy bequeathed by President Kim Il Sung out of patriotism as it translates the ideal and wish of the people into reality.
					 Rodong Sinmun Saturday says this in a by-lined article.
					
					 It goes on:
					
					 The President was so great that he built genuine socialism which realizes the ideal and wishes of the popular masses. His greatness found expression in that he indicated the most scientific way of accomplishing the cause of socialism, provided an eternal foundation for the accomplishment of the cause and turned the socialist politics into that of love and trust in his lifetime.
					
					 The Juche-based socialist theories like the line calling for independence in politics, self-support in economy and self-reliance in national defence and the general line of socialist construction clearly reflect the President's rare wisdom and exceptional ability of inquiry and great revolutionary practice.
					
					 Korean-style socialism is demonstrating its might as invincible one as it has single-minded unity, matchless military power and solid self-supporting economy, legacies of the President, as an eternal foundation for it.
					
					 Thanks to the President's politics of love and trust and benevolent politics, the society of the DPRK has turned into a harmonious big family based on revolutionary comradeship and sense of obligation.
					
					 The ideas and exploits of the President who built socialism centered on the popular masses are shining more brilliantly under the leadership of Kim Jong Il.
					
					 Korean-style socialism will always remain shining as long as it is under the Songun revolutionary leadership of Kim Jong Il, creditable successor to the Juche cause of socialism started by the President.

articles.title: Songun Politics Praised by Mexican Party Leader
articles.content:
Songun Politics Praised by Mexican Party Leader 
 Pyongyang, May 21 (KCNA) -- The Songun politics is the most original and just political mode, said Alberto Anaya Gutierrez, coordinator of the National Coordinating Committee of the Workers' Party of Mexico, who visited the DPRK.
					 The army and the people of the DPRK have boosted the national defence capability in every way under the Songun leadership of Kim Jong Il, he said, adding that this was one of the keys to the steady victories won by the DPRK, meeting all challenges.
					
					 The validity and vitality of the Songun politics have been clearly proved in practice, he noted, and went on:
					
					 Songun provides those countries advancing along the road of independence against imperialism with a firm guarantee for protecting national dignity and sovereignty.
					
					 He expressed belief that the army and the people of the DPRK would achieve greater successes by upholding his Songun leadership with loyalty.
					
					 The WPM will make positive efforts to boost the friendly and cooperative relations with the WPK, he declared.

articles.title: Biodiversity Protection in DPRK
articles.content:
Biodiversity Protection in DPRK
 Pyongyang, May 21 (KCNA) -- The DPRK government has paid close attention to the protection of biodiversity, said an official of the Ministry of Land and Environmental Conservation.
					 Kim Kwang Ju, a section chief of the ministry, said in an interview with KCNA on Saturday, a day before the World Day of Biological Diversity:
					
					 There are hundreds of nature reserves in the country to protect ecological environment.
					
					 The country has a law on the protection of nature reserves. All provinces, cities and counties have sanctuaries of wild animals and conduct information activities for protecting them.
					
					 A balanced forestry-agriculture management technology has been applied to mountainous areas.
					
					 Meanwhile, the government has taken necessary measures to minimize biodiversity loss, while cooperating with international organizations to this end.
					
					 It has some of what should be protected included in the UNDP's midterm plan (2011-2015).

articles.title: S. Korean Puppet Traitor Accused of Defiling Kwangju Popular Uprising
articles.content:
S. Korean Puppet Traitor Accused of Defiling Kwangju Popular Uprising
 Pyongyang, May 21 (KCNA) -- A spokesman for the Democratic Labor Party of south Korea in a commentary on May 18 accused the puppet traitor of defiling the Kwangju Popular Uprising.
					 The present chief executive of south Korea has not participated in the events commemorating the anniversaries of the Kwangju Popular Resistance held in south Korea under absurd pretexts since he came to power, the commentary noted, and continued:
					
					 Lee Myung Bak has made his appearance in prayer meetings of a specified religious organization but he has not participated in the events related to the resistance anniversaries, saying "he was too busy to do so." This is a mockery of the May 18 People's Resistance, the departed soul of the martyrs of the Kwangju resistance and the people.
					
					 Lee fully revealed his nature by defiling the spirit of the Kwangju Popular Resistance, it said, urging him to apologize to the participants in the resistance and the people.
					
					 Meanwhile, the spokesman issued a commentary on the same day denouncing the puppet group of traitors for resorting to the fascist suppression of the progressive forces in a bid to tide over its ruling crisis.

articles.title: Rally against U.S. Military Base Held in Japan
articles.content:
Rally against U.S. Military Base Held in Japan
 Pyongyang, May 21 (KCNA) -- A rally against the U.S. military base took place in Ginowan City, Okinawa Prefecture, Japan on May 15.
					 Attending it were about 3 200 people from all walks of life.
					
					 The participants in the rally pointed out that the inhabitants in the area are suffering damage from noise pollution caused by flights of U.S. military planes. They strongly demanded the withdrawal of the U.S. air-force base in Futenma from the prefecture.

articles.title: Japan's Secret Development of Nuclear Weapons Disclosed
articles.content:
Japan's Secret Development of Nuclear Weapons Disclosed
 Pyongyang, May 21 (KCNA) -- It was recently disclosed that Japan developed nuclear weapons in top secret at the Fukushima Nuclear Power Plant that caused radiation crisis, sparking off a big furor, according to foreign reports.
					 IRNA recently posted an article titled "Fukushima Nuclear Power Plant-Manufacture of Secret Nuclear Weapons" on Internet homepage.
					
					 The troubled power plant has long been suspected of reprocessing plutonium and developing nuclear weapons, the article said, and went on: 
					
					 The Japanese authorities disallowed the access to the plant by members of foreign rescue teams when catastrophic quake and tsunami created emergency at the power plant in March because they feared that the secret nuclear activities might be disclosed.
					
					 An underground tunnel was found near the nuclear reactor and two nuclear experts died for no specific reason and nuclear spent water contaminated by very high radiation leaked from the plant. All these facts prove that materials for the manufacture of nuclear weapons rather than those for the generation of energy were inside the reactor.
					
					 A particular note should be made of the fact that the Japanese authorities held all those concerned with the plant in an isolated area with no access to communications following the accident, the article said, adding that Japan's persistent denial of the nuclear cooperation with the U.S. clearly proves that it has confidentially pushed forward its nuclear weapons program.
					
					 The Russian Vostok Media quoted the former chief editor of the Japan Times as saying that the nuclear weapons were being developed at the power plant which the authorities tried to conceal. After the accident Japan tried to remove anything that can indicate the nuclear development, it added.
					
					 The media asserted that if it is true it should not be overlooked.

articles.title: Exploits of Kim Il Sung Praised in Switzerland
articles.content:
Exploits of Kim Il Sung Praised in Switzerland
 Pyongyang, May 21 (KCNA) -- The Switzerland-Korea Committee posted an article accompanied with a portrait of President Kim Il Sung on Internet website to mark the 39th anniversary of the Three Principles of National Reunification laid down by him.
					 The article said that Kim Il Sung was the great leader of the Korean people who performed immortal exploits in the history of Korea's reunification movement by working hard till the last moments of his life to reunify the country divided by the U.S. imperialists after its liberation.
					
					 Kim Il Sung met with a representative of the south side who came to Pyongyang to participate in the north-south high-level political talks in May 1972 and clarified the three principles of national reunification, the article noted, adding:
					
					 The three principles of national reunification were announced at home and abroad as a reunification programme common to the nation through a north-south joint statement on July 4 that year.
					
					 General Secretary Kim Jong Il, a creditable successor to the cause of Kim Il Sung, made sure that the June 15 North-South Joint Declaration and the October 4 declaration based on those three principles were adopted and published and wisely guided the cause of Korea's reunification.
					
					 There is no force on earth that can hold in check the struggle of the Korean people to achieve the reunification of the country on the three principles and this sacred cause is sure to triumph.
					
					 Meanwhile, the Swiss Group for the Study of the Juche Idea also posted a similar article illustrated with a photo of Kim Il Sung on Internet website.

articles.title: Regional Organization Introduces Drive of Korean People to Build Thriving Nation
articles.content:
Regional Organization Introduces Drive of Korean People to Build Thriving Nation 
 Pyongyang, May 21 (KCNA) -- The International Alliance of Societies for the Study of the Juche Idea and Songun Policy in East European and Central Asian Regions posted an article introducing the Korean people in their struggle for building a great prosperous and powerful nation on Internet homepage on May 16.
					 The article said that the Korean people would surely build a great prosperous and powerful socialist nation where the desire of President Kim Il Sung and the plan of leader Kim Jong Il would come true under the experienced and tested leadership of the Workers' Party of Korea.
					
					 The DPRK built many objects including chicken, duck, pig and ostrich farms in its various parts to improve the standard of people's living, it noted, and continued:
					
					 The Korean people put light industry and agriculture on a new scientific and technological basis, opening a bright prospect for decisively improving the standard of people's living.
					
					 The energetic leadership of Kim Jong Il to provide a rich and highly civilized life to the people has brought about brilliant fruition in recent years.

articles.title: Mexican Newspaper Introduces DPRK
articles.content:
Mexican Newspaper Introduces DPRK
 Pyongyang, May 21 (KCNA) -- The May 15th issue of the Mexican newspaper Unidad Nacional carried a photo of leader Kim Jong Il on his revolutionary activities and devoted a whole page to an article titled "Sturgeon goes to sea while the DPRK advances into the world".
					 The DPRK has recently established a system of breeding sturgeon on a large scale and completely succeeded in its breeding in sea. This draws the attention of the world, the article noted.
					
					 It introduced in detail the Ryongjong Fish Breeding Ground and the Ryongyon Seaside Fish Farm.
					
					 It went on:
					
					 The above-said stirring reality eloquently proves the spirit and might of the DPRK making a leap forward in the efforts to build a thriving nation.
					
					 After defining it as one of the important criteria of a thriving nation to enable the people to live with nothing to desire more in the world, Kim Jong Il unrolled a plan to fully provide the people with rare high quality fishes including sturgeon and clearly indicated orientation and ways to do so.
					
					 He made sure that modern fish breeding centers were built in different parts of the country and a delicacy restaurant was constructed at famous Okryu Restaurant in the heart of Pyongyang to serve sturgeon and other well-known dishes.
					
					 The sentence "Sturgeon goes to sea while the DPRK advances into the world" vividly reflects the reality and future of the DPRK.

articles.title: Nationwide Help to Countryside
articles.content:
Nationwide Help to Countryside
 Pyongyang, May 21 (KCNA) -- Officials, workers and office employees and even members of neighborhood units across the country are now all out to help farmers after the kick-off of rice transplantation. 
					 More than two times as many people as those in the last year are now giving helping hands to the farmers. 
					
					 Employees of the ministries and national institutions are taking the lead in the campaign.
					
					 Employees of the Ministry of Construction and Building Materials Industry are reporting signal successes in rice transplantation and maize planting.
					
					 The Ministry of Foodstuff and Daily Necessities Industry, the Ministry of Machine-Building Industry, the Ministry of Post and Telecommunications, the Ministry of Land and Marine Transport, the Ministry of Foreign Trade and the Ministry of Land and Environmental Conservation are helping farms settle their issues in a responsible manner while lots of public officials are giving sincere helping hands to farmers in their immediate farm work.
					
					 Officials and other working people in various provinces are also sincere in helping farmers.
					
					 At least 40 000 more people than those involved in the same period last year are joining farmers in transplanting rice seedlings everyday in South Hwanghae Province.
					
					 A sharply increasing number of people are giving effective helping hands to farmers in North and South Phyongan, North Hwanghae Province, North and South Hamgyong and Ryanggang provinces.

articles.title: Chinese Paper Introduces DPRK Wing of World Horticultural Expo
articles.content:
Chinese Paper Introduces DPRK Wing of World Horticultural Expo
 Pyongyang, May 21 (KCNA) -- The May 10 issue of "Flesh News of the World Horticultural Expo" of China carried an article titled "Beautiful flowers, wonderful art and fantastic scenery. The DPRK wing attracts visitors" introducing the DPRK wing of the 2011 Xi'an World Horticultural Expo.
					 Under the subtitle "Charm of flowers-the background against which the beautiful flowers came into being" the article said that the DPRK wing is drawing the attention of visitors as it displays Kimilsungias and Kimjongilias bearing the august names of the peerlessly great men. Visitors vied with each other to take pictures before them, it added.
					
					 Nothing can match the beauty of these flowers, the paper said, explaining how these famous flowers came into being and recalling  that they were repeatedly awarded special prizes, gold medals, diplomas and the best prizes at the world flower shows.
					
					 Under the subtitles "Charm of art-wonderful handicraft" and "Charm of scenic beauty-rhythm of fountain, peculiarity of flowers and simple building" it carried articles introduced in detail the DPRK wing arranged in a peculiar national style, handicraft and stamps displayed there.

articles.title: Ecuadorian President Calls for Promoting Regional Integration
articles.content:
Ecuadorian President Calls for Promoting Regional Integration
 Pyongyang, May 21 (KCNA) -- Ecuadorian President Rafael Correa, addressing a meeting of the Andean Community of Nations (CAN) on Tuesday, called on the CAN countries to work for a global integration in the Andean region.
					 "We should work in a global integration, where we, next to the agenda on the economy and trade, also have a social, political, cultural and environmental agenda, an agenda that is directed for the good of the people," he said. He stressed the need for the member nations of the CAN to strive to settle them.

articles.title: UN Humanitarian Chief Urges Israel to Lift Blockade
articles.content:
UN Humanitarian Chief Urges Israel to Lift Blockade
						
 Pyongyang, May 21 (KCNA) -- The UN under-secretary-general for Humanitarian Affairs in a press release on May 17 accused Israel of blockading the Gaza Strip of Palestine.
					 The release said that the blockade in Gaza has resulted in a "stifling of economic activity and a serious decline in education, healthcare and water and sanitation services."
					
					 "Consequently 1.1 million Gazans are dependent on food aid due to the blockade," it said, adding: The citizens have been hit hardest by the impact of the policy of restrictions and have had to endure unnecessary humanitarian suffering.  
					
					 The release urged the Israeli authorities to immediately lift the blockade.

articles.title: Earthquake Hits Brazil
articles.content:
Earthquake Hits Brazil
 Pyongyang, May 21 (KCNA) -- A 6-magnitude earthquake hit the waters off the southeast area of Brazil on May 15.
					 The epicenter was 1 227 km from Natal, an eastern coastal city.

articles.title: Iran Slams U.S. and Other Western Countries' Sanctions
articles.content:
Iran Slams U.S. and Other Western Countries' Sanctions
 Tehran, May 19 (KCNA) -- Iranian Foreign Ministry spokesman Ramin Mehmanparast bitterly accused the U.S. and other Western countries of their continued sanctions against his country. 
					 In an interview with a TV Tuesday he said that the U.S. sanctions against Iran will not stop Iranians from pursuing their rights over their nuclear program.
					
					 He stressed that such sanctions have no effect on the Iranian nation's will and resolution.

articles.title: Electricity Supply Network Built in Sichuan, China
articles.content:
Electricity Supply Network Built in Sichuan, China
 Beijing, May 19 (KCNA) -- Sichuan Province of China has pushed forward the construction of electricity supply network for three years since the great earthquake in Wenchuan, carrying out all the tasks for the project.
					 During the period the province built new 27 transformer substations and laid 1 200 km-long transmission line. It also supplied electricity to 389 000 houses.

articles.title: Four NATO Soldiers Killed in Afghanistan
articles.content:
Four NATO Soldiers Killed in Afghanistan
 Pyongyang, May 21 (KCNA) -- The NATO-led force in Afghanistan was attacked again by the resistance forces of the country.
					 Four NATO soldiers were killed on Monday in improvised explosive device blast in Afghanistan's southern region.

articles.title: U.S. and Japanese Businesses in Slowdown
articles.content:
U.S. and Japanese Businesses in Slowdown
 Pyongyang, May 21 (KCNA) -- For April, U.S. privately-owned housing starts were at a seasonally adjusted annual rate of 523 000. This was 10.6 percent below the revised estimate for March this year, the U.S. Commerce Department said as quoting survey data on May 17.
					 This is because privately-owned housing units are in the slowdown.
					
					 Meanwhile, Tokyo Electric Power Co. of Japan plans to book a group net loss of more than 800 billion yen for fiscal 2010 ended in March, sources close to the matter said Monday.

articles.title: Russia Accuses U.S. of Its Unilateral Attempt to Build MD
articles.content:
Russia Accuses U.S. of Its Unilateral Attempt to Build MD
 Moscow, May 19 (KCNA) -- Dmitri Rogozin, Russian permanent representative at NATO, in a recent press conference criticized the U.S. for its unilateral attempt to build the missile defense system in Europe.
					 It is impossible to build the MD in Europe while excluding Russia, he said, adding that in case of establishment of MD, Russia's system for early warning on missile attack will rapidly react to it.
					
					 The range of interceptor missile of the U.S. MD should not cover Russia's territory, he said, declaring that Russia will overcome the threat posed to it by itself.

articles.title: China's Efforts to Develop Science and Technology
articles.content:
China's Efforts to Develop Science and Technology
 Beijing, May 19 (KCNA) -- A week of scientific and technical activities for this year has opened with due ceremony in China on May 14.
					 Liu Yandong, member of the Political Bureau of the Central Committee of the Communist Party of China and state councilor, addressed the ceremony. She underlined the need to continue to push ahead with the scientific and technical progress and innovation, widely introduce science and technology and promote overall economic and social development to provide popular masses with more beautiful and happy life.

articles.title: Building United Front Called for-Chinese State Councilor
articles.content:
Building United Front Called for-Chinese State Councilor
 Beijing, May 19 (KCNA) -- A meeting was held in Beijing on May 15 to celebrate the 70th anniversary of the Democratic League of China.
					 Liu Yandong, member of the Political Bureau of the Central Committee of the Communist Party of China and state councilor, made a report there.
					
					  The CPC would maintain and perfect multi-party cooperation and political consultation system led by the communist party and let the democratic 
					
					 factions give full play to their roles in the state politics and social life, thus consolidating the broadest patriotic and united front, Liu said.

articles.title: State Theatrical Troupe
articles.content:
State Theatrical Troupe
 Pyongyang, May 21 (KCNA) -- The State Theatrical Troupe of the DPRK is celebrating its 65th anniversary on May 23.
					 Its predecessor, the National Art Troupe, was organized on the initiative of President Kim Il Sung a year after the country's liberation from the Japanese colonial rule.
					
					 Its first drama is "Thunder" based on the Pochonbo Battle conducted under the command of the President in the period of the anti-Japanese armed struggle.
					
					 During the Fatherland Liberation War, the troupe encouraged the army and people with "Route of Charge" and other plays.
					
					 It created many plays about feats of the Korean people in the post-war rehabilitation and construction and in the socialist construction.
					
					 Afterwards, it entered a new stage of its development under the guidance of the Workers' Party of Korea.
					
					 The troupe successfully recreated the masterpiece "The Shrine" with the introduction of music, songs and three-dimensional stage art and decorations.
					
					 On the basis of the achievement, other famous works "Blood at an International Conference", "A Letter from a Daughter", "Three Pretenders" and "Celebrations" were renewed and "Wish" and "Mother's Request" created.
					
					 A few years ago, it recreated the light comedy "Echo of Mountain" to enjoy a great popularity as a masterpiece representing literature and art in the Songun (military-first) era.

articles.title: China's Vigorous Drive to Prevent Economic Crimes
articles.content:
China's Efforts to Develop Science and Technology
 Beijing, May 19 (KCNA) -- A week of scientific and technical activities for this year has opened with due ceremony in China on May 14.
					 Liu Yandong, member of the Political Bureau of the Central Committee of the Communist Party of China and state councilor, addressed the ceremony. She underlined the need to continue to push ahead with the scientific and technical progress and innovation, widely introduce science and technology and promote overall economic and social development to provide popular masses with more beautiful and happy life.

articles.title: Russian Govt. to Double Funds for Kurile Islands
articles.content:
Russian Govt. to Double Funds for Kurile Islands
 Moscow, May 19 (KCNA) -- The Russian government plans to double the investment in Kurile Islands for their development.
					 The governor of Sakhalin Region recently said that the government will allocate additional 16 billion Rbl for the development of the transport infrastructure, social fields and others on the islands.

articles.title: Two Americans Arrested in Sri Lanka
articles.content:
Two Americans Arrested in Sri Lanka
 Pyongyang, May 21 (KCNA) -- Two U.S. nationals have been arrested at the Bandaranaike international airport in Colombo, the state radio Lakhanda announced Thursday. 
					 The radio said they were arrested Wednesday night when trying to board an aircraft with a weapon concealed in their luggage.

articles.title: Water Saving Campaign in Beijing
articles.content:
Water Saving Campaign in Beijing 
 Beijing, May 19 (KCNA) -- Information service for saving water was conducted in Beijing on the theme of "improvement of urban water ecology and dissemination of the technology for the use of renewable water" on May 15.
					 That day the municipal government called on all fields and units of the society to more effectively and rationally use the water resources in order to contribute to building a water saving society.
					
					 In recent years the water resources per head of the population dwindled to 100 cubic meters from 300 cubic meters. So Beijing has become one of the big cities with the most acute shortage of water in the country.

articles.title: Iniciada en Corea la trasplantacion de posturas de arroz
articles.content:
Iniciada en Corea la trasplantacion de posturas de arroz
　Pyongyang, 21 de mayo (ATCC) -- Quedo iniciada en Corea la trasplantacion de las posturas de arroz.
					　Las precursoras de este ano fueron las granjas cooperativas de Wonhwa del distrito de Phyongwon y de Chongsan del municipio de Kangso, de la provincia de Phyong-an del Sur.
					
					　Ahora entraron en esa faena, a conveniencia de las condiciones climaticas locales, casi todas las granjas a lo largo del pais, excepto a las situadas en zonas montanosas septentrionales.
					
					　Anteponiendo la nivelacion de arrozales, el riego y el gradeo y asegurando el pleno funcionamiento de las maquinas, las granjas cooperativas de las provincias de Phyong-an del Sur y del Norte incrementan los resultados de trabajo.
					
					　En la provincia de Hwanghae del Sur ya trasplantaron las posturas de arroz en una extension de mas de 10 mil hectareas.
					
					　Esta labor marcha en etapa crucial en la ciudad de Haeju y los distritos de Anak, Jaeryong y Sinchon.
					
					　Las granjas cooperativas de las ciudades y los distritos de la provincia del Hwanghae del Norte, incluyendo la ciudad de Sariwon y los distritos de Yonthan y Pongsan, logran cada dia notables exitos.
					
					　Tomando en consideracion el estado de las posturas de arroz y las condiciones meteorologicas, las granjas cooperativas de las ciudades de Pyongyang y de Nampho arrancaron muy bien en el mismo quehacer.
					
					　No se quedan a la zaga las ciudades de Wonsan, Hamhung y Kim Chaek, los distritos de Chonnae, Hamju y Hwadae y otras zonas litorales del Mar Este de Corea.

articles.title: Se revela el desarrollo en secreto de armas nucleares por Japon
articles.content:
Se revela el desarrollo en secreto de armas nucleares por Japon
　Pyongyang, 21 de mayo (ATCC) -- Segun fuentes extranjeras, dice que Japon vino desarrollando en supersecreto las armas nucleares en la central nuclear de Fukushima envuelta ahora en la crisis de radiactividad.
					  Recientemente, la IRNA de Iran publico en su pagina web un articulo intitulado "La central nuclear de Fukushima - la fabricacion en secreto de armas nucleares".
					
					  Segun el articulo, esta central es sospechada desde hace mucho tiempo por reprocesamiento de las cenizas de plutonio y de desarrollo de armas nucleares.
					
					　Cuando se produjo en marzo pasado la situacion de emergencia en esa planta nuclear debido al devastador terremoto y el subsiguiente tsunami, las autoridades japonesas se negaron a admitir a los rescatistas extranjeros por el temor a la revelacion de sus actividades nucleares secretas, asevero.
					
					   El descubrimiento de una galeria en los alrededores del reactor, la muerte incognita de 2 tecnicos nucleares y la fuga de las aguas residuales nucleares contaminadas con fuerte radiactividad confirman que se preparaban ahi los materiales mas para la produccion de arma nuclear que la obtencion de energia, especifico.
					
					  Sobre todo, despues del accidente, las autoridades japonesas mantuvieron apartados a todos los relacionados de la central en un lugar donde fueron cortadas las comunicaciones, revelo.
					
					　Ademas, la obstinada negativa de ellas a la cooperacion nuclear con Estados Unidos comprueba de por si que ese pais isleno vino impulsando en supersecreto su programa nuclear, concluyo.
					
					  Por otra parte, la agencia noticiera rusa Vostok Media informo que Japon trato de eliminar las huellas de desarrollo de armas nucleares despues del accidente, citando al ex editor en jefe de Japan Times quien revelo que las autoridades japonesas estan ocultando el evidente desarrollo de armas nucleares en el sotano de la central nuclear de Fukushima.
					
					　Los medios de prensa opinan que eso no se puede pasar inadvertido.

articles.title: Todo el pais ayuda al campo
articles.content:
Todo el pais ayuda al campo
　Pyongyang, 21 de mayo (ATCC) -- Al iniciarse el transplante de posturas de arroz, se intensifica la asistencia laboral al campo.
					　Los funcionarios, trabajadores, oficinistas y hasta las amas de casa de diferentes localidades del pais acudieron a las granjas cooperativas.
					
					　En estos dias, el numero de los participantes en la ayuda al campo sobrepasa el doble de los movilizados en el igual periodo del ano pasado.
					
					　Al frente de la asistencia, estan los funcionarios publicos de los ministerios y organos centrales, a saber, el Ministerio de Construccion e Industria de Materiales de Construccion, el Ministerio de la Industria Alimentaria y de Necesidades Diarias, el Ministerio de Industria Mecanica, el Ministerio de Comunicaciones, el Ministerio de Transporte Terrestre y Maritimo, el Ministerio de Comercio Exterior y el Ministerio de Proteccion Territorial y Ambiental.
					
					　Ellos ayudan con sinceridad el trasplante de las posturas de arroz, la siembra de maiz, etc. y solucionan en la posicion de duenos los problemas surgidos en las granjas.
					
					　Por otra parte, se incremento notablemente el numero de asistentes de todas las provincias, especialmente, de Phyong-an del Sur y del  Norte, de Hwanghae del Norte y del Sur, de Hamgyong del Norte y de Ryanggang. 
					
					　En particular, en la provincia de Hwanghae del  Sur se incorporan diariamente mas de 40 mil en comparacion con el igual periodo del ano pasado.
